topic_or_construct: ability to handle a financial shock
justification: In Experiment 1 participants were “asked how confident they were in their ability to handle a specific type and size of financial shock, and rated their confidence on a scale from 1 to 4 (1 = could … 4 = could not).”
Experiment 2 states that participants “rated how difficult it would be to cope with the scenario (1 = I will not have any difficulty, 7 = I will have significant difficulties).”
For the same experiment, participants judged “how much impact it would have on their daily life (1 = It will have no negative impact whatsoever, 7 = It will have significant negative impacts).”

The paper notes “There were three statements assessing perception of loss and we calculated an average score as a measure of loss perception,” each rated 1–7 with anchors such as “completely disagree” to “completely agree.”

topic_or_construct: willingness to save for future emergencies
justification: Participants indicated “how willing they would be to save money for future unexpected shocks (1 = not willing at all … 7 = very willing). … We also used three statements assessing willingness to save to calculate an average score.”
After the affirmation/control writing task, participants answered “How do you feel about yourself right now? (1 = not positive at all, 4 = neutral, 7 = very positive).”
They also answered “How confident are you that you will be able to handle problems arising in the future? (1 = not confident at all, 4 = neutral, 7 = very confident).”
